013package org.apache.juneau.http.header;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022import java.util.stream.*;
023
024import org.apache.http.*;
025import org.apache.http.util.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.http.HttpHeaders;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
030
031/**
032 * A simple list of HTTP headers with various convenience methods.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
035 * <p class='bjava'>
036 *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = HeaderList
037 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
038 *       .append(Accept.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"text/xml"</js>))
039 *       .append(<js>"Content-Type"</js>, ()-&gt;<jsm>getDynamicContentTypeFromSomewhere</jsm>());
040 * </p>
041 *
042 * <p>
043 * Convenience creators are provided for creating lists with minimal code:
044 * <p class='bjava'>
045 *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = HeaderList.<jsm>of</jsm>(Accept.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>, ContentType.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>);
046 * </p>
047 *
048 * <p>
049 * Static methods are provided on {@link HttpHeaders} to further simplify creation of header lists.
050 * <p class='bjava'>
051 *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.http.HttpHeaders.*;
052 *
053 *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = <jsm>headerList</jsm>(<jsm>accept</jsm>(<js>"text/xml"</js>), <jsm>contentType</jsm>(<js>"text/xml"</js>));
054 * </p>
055 *
056 * <ul class='seealso'>
057 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-common">juneau-rest-common</a>
058 * </ul>
059 */
060@FluentSetters
061public class HeaderList extends ControlledArrayList<Header> {
062
063   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
064
065   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
066   // Static
067   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
068
069   /** Represents no header list in annotations. */
070   public static final class Void extends HeaderList {
071      private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
072   }
073
074   /**
075    * Instantiates a new list.
076    *
077    * @return A new list.
078    */
079   public static HeaderList create() {
080      return new HeaderList();
081   }
082
083   /**
084    * Creates a new {@link HeaderList} initialized with the specified headers.
085    *
086    * @param headers
087    *    The headers to add to the list.
088    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
089    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
090    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
091    */
092   public static HeaderList of(List<Header> headers) {
093      return new HeaderList().append(headers);
094   }
095
096   /**
097    * Creates a new {@link HeaderList} initialized with the specified headers.
098    *
099    * @param headers
100    *    The headers to add to the list.
101    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
102    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
103    */
104   public static HeaderList of(Header...headers) {
105      return new HeaderList().append(headers);
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Creates a new {@link HeaderList} initialized with the specified name/value pairs.
110    *
111    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
112    * <p class='bjava'>
113    *    HeaderList <jv>headers</jv> = HeaderList.<jsm>ofPairs</jsm>(<js>"Accept"</js>, <js>"text/xml"</js>, <js>"Content-Type"</js>, <js>"text/xml"</js>);
114    * </p>
115    *
116    * @param pairs
117    *    Initial list of pairs.
118    *    <br>Must be an even number of parameters representing key/value pairs.
119    * @throws RuntimeException If odd number of parameters were specified.
120    * @return A new instance.
121    */
122   public static HeaderList ofPairs(String...pairs) {
123      HeaderList x = new HeaderList();
124      if (pairs == null)
125         pairs = new String[0];
126      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
127         throw new RuntimeException("Odd number of parameters passed into HeaderList.ofPairs()");
128      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
129         x.add(BasicHeader.of(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]));
130      return x;
131   }
132
133   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134   // Instance
135   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
136
137   private VarResolver varResolver;
138   boolean caseSensitive;
139
140   /**
141    * Constructor.
142    */
143   public HeaderList() {
144      super(false);
145   }
146
147   /**
148    * Copy constructor.
149    *
150    * @param copyFrom The bean to copy.
151    */
152   protected HeaderList(HeaderList copyFrom) {
153      super(false, copyFrom);
154      caseSensitive = copyFrom.caseSensitive;
155   }
156
157   /**
158    * Makes a copy of this list.
159    *
160    * @return A new copy of this list.
161    */
162   public HeaderList copy() {
163      return new HeaderList(this);
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * Adds a collection of default headers.
168    *
169    * <p>
170    * Default headers are set if they're not already in the list.
171    *
172    * @param headers The list of default headers.
173    * @return This object.
174    */
175   public HeaderList setDefault(List<Header> headers) {
176      if (headers != null)
177         headers.stream().filter(x -> x != null && ! contains(x.getName())).forEach(x -> set(x));
178      return this;
179   }
180
181   /**
182    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
183    *
184    * @param name The header name.
185    * @param value The header value.
186    * @return This object.
187    */
188   public HeaderList setDefault(String name, Object value) {
189      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
190   }
191
192   /**
193    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
194    *
195    * @param name The header name.
196    * @param value The header value.
197    * @return This object.
198    */
199   public HeaderList setDefault(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
200      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
201   }
202
203   /**
204    * Makes a copy of this list of headers and adds a collection of default headers.
205    *
206    * <p>
207    * Default headers are set if they're not already in the list.
208    *
209    * @param headers The list of default headers.
210    * @return A new list, or the same list if the headers were empty.
211    */
212   public HeaderList setDefault(Header...headers) {
213      if (headers != null)
214         setDefault(Arrays.asList(headers));
215      return this;
216   }
217
218
219   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
220   // Properties
221   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
222
223   /**
224    * Allows header values to contain SVL variables.
225    *
226    * <p>
227    * Resolves variables in header values when using the following methods:
228    * <ul>
229    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
230    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
231    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
232    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
233    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
234    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
235    * </ul>
236    *
237    * <p>
238    * Uses {@link VarResolver#DEFAULT} to resolve variables.
239    *
240    * @return This object.
241    */
242   public HeaderList resolving() {
243      return resolving(VarResolver.DEFAULT);
244   }
245
246   /**
247    * Allows header values to contain SVL variables.
248    *
249    * <p>
250    * Resolves variables in header values when using the following methods:
251    * <ul>
252    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
253    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
254    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
255    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
256    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
257    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
258    * </ul>
259    *
260    * @param varResolver The variable resolver to use for resolving variables.
261    * @return This object.
262    */
263   public HeaderList resolving(VarResolver varResolver) {
264      assertModifiable();
265      this.varResolver = varResolver;
266      return this;
267   }
268
269   /**
270    * Specifies that the headers in this list should be treated as case-sensitive.
271    *
272    * <p>
273    * The default behavior is case-insensitive.
274    *
275    * @param value The new value for this setting.
276    * @return This object.
277    */
278   public HeaderList caseSensitive(boolean value) {
279      assertModifiable();
280      caseSensitive = value;
281      return this;
282   }
283
284   /**
285    * Adds the specified header to the end of the headers in this list.
286    *
287    * @param value The header to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
288    * @return This object.
289    */
290   @FluentSetter
291   public HeaderList append(Header value) {
292      if (value != null)
293         add(value);
294      return this;
295   }
296
297   /**
298    * Appends the specified header to the end of this list.
299    *
300    * <p>
301    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
302    *
303    * @param name The header name.
304    * @param value The header value.
305    * @return This object.
306    */
307   public HeaderList append(String name, Object value) {
308      return append(createPart(name, value));
309   }
310
311   /**
312    * Appends the specified header to the end of this list using a value supplier.
313    *
314    * <p>
315    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
316    *
317    * <p>
318    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicHeader#getValue()}.
319    *
320    * @param name The header name.
321    * @param value The header value supplier.
322    * @return This object.
323    */
324   public HeaderList append(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
325      return append(createPart(name, value));
326   }
327
328   /**
329    * Adds the specified headers to the end of the headers in this list.
330    *
331    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
332    * @return This object.
333    */
334   @FluentSetter
335   public HeaderList append(Header...values) {
336      if (values != null)
337         for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
338            if (values[i] != null)
339               append(values[i]);
340      return this;
341   }
342
343   /**
344    * Adds the specified headers to the end of the headers in this list.
345    *
346    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
347    * @return This object.
348    */
349   @FluentSetter
350   public HeaderList append(List<Header> values) {
351      if (values != null)
352         values.forEach(x -> append(x));
353      return this;
354   }
355
356   /**
357    * Adds the specified header to the beginning of the headers in this list.
358    *
359    * @param value The header to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
360    * @return This object.
361    */
362   @FluentSetter
363   public HeaderList prepend(Header value) {
364      if (value != null)
365         add(0, value);
366      return this;
367   }
368
369   /**
370    * Appends the specified header to the beginning of this list.
371    *
372    * <p>
373    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
374    *
375    * @param name The header name.
376    * @param value The header value.
377    * @return This object.
378    */
379   public HeaderList prepend(String name, Object value) {
380      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
381   }
382
383   /**
384    * Appends the specified header to the beginning of this list using a value supplier.
385    *
386    * <p>
387    * The header is added as a {@link BasicHeader}.
388    *
389    * <p>
390    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicHeader#getValue()}.
391    *
392    * @param name The header name.
393    * @param value The header value supplier.
394    * @return This object.
395    */
396   public HeaderList prepend(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
397      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
398   }
399
400   /**
401    * Adds the specified headers to the beginning of the headers in this list.
402    *
403    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
404    * @return This object.
405    */
406   @FluentSetter
407   public HeaderList prepend(Header...values) {
408      if (values != null)
409         prepend(alist(values));
410      return this;
411   }
412
413   /**
414    * Adds the specified headers to the beginning of the headers in this list.
415    *
416    * @param values The headers to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
417    * @return This object.
418    */
419   @FluentSetter
420   public HeaderList prepend(List<Header> values) {
421      if (values != null)
422         addAll(0, values);
423      return this;
424   }
425
426   /**
427    * Removes the specified header from this list.
428    *
429    * @param value The header to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
430    * @return This object.
431    */
432   @FluentSetter
433   public HeaderList remove(Header value) {
434      if (value != null)
435         removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), value.getName()) && eq(x.getValue(), value.getValue()));
436      return this;
437   }
438
439   /**
440    * Removes the specified headers from this list.
441    *
442    * @param values The headers to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
443    * @return This object.
444    */
445   @FluentSetter
446   public HeaderList remove(Header...values) {
447      for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
448         remove(values[i]);
449      return this;
450   }
451
452   /**
453    * Removes the specified headers from this list.
454    *
455    * @param values The headers to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
456    * @return This object.
457    */
458   @FluentSetter
459   public HeaderList remove(List<Header> values) {
460      if (values != null)
461         values.forEach(x -> remove(x));
462      return this;
463   }
464
465   /**
466    * Removes the header with the specified name from this list.
467    *
468    * @param name The header name.
469    * @return This object.
470    */
471   @FluentSetter
472   public HeaderList remove(String name) {
473      removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
474      return this;
475   }
476
477   /**
478    * Removes the header with the specified name from this list.
479    *
480    * @param names The header name.
481    * @return This object.
482    */
483   @FluentSetter
484   public HeaderList remove(String...names) {
485      if (names != null)
486         for (int i = 0; i < names.length; i++)
487            remove(names[i]);
488      return this;
489   }
490
491   /**
492    * Removes all headers from this list.
493    *
494    * @return This object.
495    */
496   public HeaderList removeAll() {
497      clear();
498      return this;
499   }
500
501   /**
502    * Adds or replaces the header(s) with the same name.
503    *
504    * <p>
505    * If no header with the same name is found the given header is added to the end of the list.
506    *
507    * @param value The headers to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
508    * @return This object.
509    */
510   @FluentSetter
511   public HeaderList set(Header value) {
512      if (value != null) {
513         boolean replaced = false;
514         for (int i = 0, j = size(); i < j; i++) {
515            Header x = get(i);
516            if (eq(x.getName(), value.getName())) {
517               if (replaced) {
518                  remove(i);
519                  j--;
520               } else {
521                  set(i, value);
522                  replaced = true;
523               }
524            }
525         }
526
527         if (! replaced)
528            add(value);
529      }
530
531      return this;
532   }
533
534   /**
535    * Adds or replaces the header(s) with the same name.
536    *
537    * <p>
538    * If no header with the same name is found the given header is added to the end of the list.
539    *
540    * @param values The headers to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
541    * @return This object.
542    */
543   @FluentSetter
544   public HeaderList set(Header...values) {
545      if (values != null)
546         set(alist(values));
547      return this;
548   }
549
550   /**
551    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
552    *
553    * @param name The header name.
554    * @param value The header value.
555    * @return This object.
556    */
557   public HeaderList set(String name, Object value) {
558      return set(createPart(name, value));
559   }
560
561   /**
562    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
563    *
564    * @param name The header name.
565    * @param value The header value.
566    * @return This object.
567    */
568   public HeaderList set(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
569      return set(createPart(name, value));
570   }
571
572   /**
573    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
574    *
575    * <p>
576    * If no header with the same name is found the given header is added to the end of the list.
577    *
578    * @param values The headers to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
579    * @return This object.
580    */
581   @FluentSetter
582   public HeaderList set(List<Header> values) {
583
584      if (values != null) {
585         for (int i1 = 0, j1 = values.size(); i1 < j1; i1++) {
586            Header h = values.get(i1);
587            if (h != null) {
588               for (int i2 = 0, j2 = size(); i2 < j2; i2++) {
589                  Header x = get(i2);
590                  if (eq(x.getName(), h.getName())) {
591                     remove(i2);
592                     j2--;
593                  }
594               }
595            }
596         }
597
598         for (int i = 0, j = values.size(); i < j; i++) {
599            Header x = values.get(i);
600            if (x != null) {
601               add(x);
602            }
603         }
604      }
605
606      return this;
607   }
608
609   /**
610    * Gets the first header with the given name.
611    *
612    * <p>
613    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
614    *
615    * @param name The header name.
616    * @return The first matching header, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
617    */
618   public Optional<Header> getFirst(String name) {
619      for (int i = 0; i < size(); i++) {
620         Header x = get(i);
621         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
622            return optional(x);
623      }
624      return empty();
625   }
626
627   /**
628    * Gets the last header with the given name.
629    *
630    * <p>
631    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
632    *
633    * @param name The header name.
634    * @return The last matching header, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
635    */
636   public Optional<Header> getLast(String name) {
637      for (int i = size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
638         Header x = get(i);
639         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
640            return optional(x);
641      }
642      return empty();
643   }
644
645   /**
646    * Gets a header representing all of the header values with the given name.
647    *
648    * <p>
649    * If more that one header with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
650    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
651    *
652    * @param name The header name.
653    * @return A header with a condensed value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if no headers by the given name are present
654    */
655   public Optional<Header> get(String name) {
656
657      Header first = null;
658      List<Header> rest = null;
659      for (Header x : this) {
660         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
661            if (first == null)
662               first = x;
663            else {
664               if (rest == null)
665                  rest = list();
666               rest.add(x);
667            }
668         }
669      }
670
671      if (first == null)
672         return empty();
673
674      if (rest == null)
675         return optional(first);
676
677      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
678      sb.append(first.getValue());
679      for (int i = 0; i < rest.size(); i++) {
680         sb.append(", ");
681         sb.append(rest.get(i).getValue());
682      }
683
684      return optional(new BasicHeader(name, sb.toString()));
685   }
686
687   /**
688    * Gets a header representing all of the header values with the given name.
689    *
690    * <p>
691    * If more that one header with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
692    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
693    *
694    * <p>
695    * The implementation class must have a public constructor taking in one of the following argument lists:
696    * <ul>
697    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
698    *    <li><c>X(Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
699    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
700    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
701    * </ul>
702    *
703    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
704    * <p class='bjava'>
705    *    BasicIntegerHeader <jv>age</jv> = headerList.get(<js>"Age"</js>, BasicIntegerHeader.<jk>class</jk>);
706    * </p>
707    *
708    * @param <T> The header implementation class.
709    * @param name The header name.
710    * @param type The header implementation class.
711    * @return A header with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no headers by the given name are present
712    */
713   public <T> Optional<T> get(String name, Class<T> type) {
714
715      Header first = null;
716      List<Header> rest = null;
717      for (Header x : this) {
718         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
719            if (first == null)
720               first = x;
721            else {
722               if (rest == null)
723                  rest = list();
724               rest.add(x);
725            }
726         }
727      }
728
729      if (first == null)
730         return empty();
731
732      if (rest == null)
733         return optional(HeaderBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, first.getValue()));
734
735      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
736      sb.append(first.getValue());
737      for (int i = 0; i < rest.size(); i++) {
738         sb.append(", ");
739         sb.append(rest.get(i).getValue());
740      }
741
742      return optional(HeaderBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, sb.toString()));
743   }
744
745   /**
746    * Gets a header representing all of the header values with the given name.
747    *
748    * <p>
749    * Same as {@link #get(String, Class)} but the header name is pulled from the {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Header#name()} or
750    *    {@link org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.Header#value()} annotations.
751    *
752    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
753    * <p class='bjava'>
754    *    Age <jv>age</jv> = headerList.get(Age.<jk>class</jk>);
755    * </p>
756    *
757    * @param <T> The return type.
758    * @param type The header implementation class.
759    * @return A header with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no headers by the given name are present
760    */
761   public <T> Optional<T> get(Class<T> type) {
762      assertArgNotNull("type", type);
763
764      String name = HeaderBeanMeta.of(type).getSchema().getName();
765      assertArg(name != null, "Header name could not be found on bean type ''{0}''", type.getName());
766
767      return get(name, type);
768   }
769
770   /**
771    * Gets all of the headers.
772    *
773    * <p>
774    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the headers were added.
775    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
776    *
777    * <p>
778    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
779    * get headers.
780    *
781    * @return An array containing all headers, never <jk>null</jk>.
782    */
783   public Header[] getAll() {
784      return stream().toArray(Header[]::new);
785   }
786
787   /**
788    * Gets all of the headers with the given name.
789    *
790    * <p>
791    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the headers were added.
792    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
793    * Headers with null values are ignored.
794    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
795    *
796    * <p>
797    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
798    * get headers.
799    *
800    * @param name The header name.
801    *
802    * @return An array containing all matching headers, never <jk>null</jk>.
803    */
804   public Header[] getAll(String name) {
805      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).toArray(Header[]::new);
806   }
807
808   /**
809    * Performs an action on the values for all matching headers in this list.
810    *
811    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
812    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
813    * @return This object.
814    */
815   public HeaderList forEachValue(Predicate<Header> filter, Consumer<String> action) {
816      return forEach(filter, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
817   }
818
819   /**
820    * Performs an action on the values of all matching headers in this list.
821    *
822    * @param name The header name.
823    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
824    * @return This object.
825    */
826   public HeaderList forEachValue(String name, Consumer<String> action) {
827      return forEach(name, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
828   }
829
830   /**
831    * Returns all the string values for all headers with the specified name.
832    *
833    * @param name The header name.
834    * @return An array containing all values.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
835    */
836   public String[] getValues(String name) {
837      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).map(x -> x.getValue()).toArray(String[]::new);
838   }
839
840   /**
841    * Tests if headers with the given name are contained within this list.
842    *
843    * <p>
844    * Header name comparison is case insensitive.
845    *
846    * @param name The header name.
847    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one header with the name is present.
848    */
849   public boolean contains(String name) {
850      return stream().anyMatch(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
851   }
852
853   /**
854    * Returns an iterator over this list of headers.
855    *
856    * @return A new iterator over this list of headers.
857    */
858   public HeaderIterator headerIterator() {
859      return new BasicHeaderIterator(toArray(new Header[0]), null, caseSensitive);
860   }
861
862   /**
863    * Returns an iterator over the headers with a given name in this list.
864    *
865    * @param name The name of the headers over which to iterate, or <jk>null</jk> for all headers
866    *
867    * @return A new iterator over the matching headers in this list.
868    */
869   public HeaderIterator headerIterator(String name) {
870      return new BasicHeaderIterator(getAll(name), name, caseSensitive);
871   }
872
873   /**
874    * Performs an action on all headers with the specified name in this list.
875    *
876    * <p>
877    * This is the preferred method for iterating over headers as it does not involve
878    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
879    *
880    * @param name The header name.
881    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
882    * @return This object.
883    */
884   public HeaderList forEach(String name, Consumer<Header> action) {
885      return forEach(x -> eq(name, x.getName()), action);
886   }
887
888   /**
889    * Performs an action on all matching headers in this list.
890    *
891    * <p>
892    * This is the preferred method for iterating over headers as it does not involve
893    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
894    *
895    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
896    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
897    * @return This object.
898    */
899   public HeaderList forEach(Predicate<Header> filter, Consumer<Header> action) {
900      forEach(x -> consume(filter, action, x));
901      return this;
902   }
903
904   /**
905    * Returns a stream of the headers in this list with the specified name.
906    *
907    * <p>
908    * This does not involve a copy of the underlying array of <c>Header</c> objects so should perform well.
909    *
910    * @param name The header name.
911    * @return This object.
912    */
913   public Stream<Header> stream(String name) {
914      return stream().filter(x->eq(name, x.getName()));
915   }
916
917   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
918   // Other methods
919   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
920
921   /**
922    * Creates a new header out of the specified name/value pair.
923    *
924    * @param name The header name.
925    * @param value The header value.
926    * @return A new header.
927    */
928   private Header createPart(String name, Object value) {
929      boolean isResolving = varResolver != null;
930
931      if (value instanceof Supplier<?>) {
932         Supplier<?> value2 = (Supplier<?>)value;
933         return isResolving ? new BasicHeader(name, resolver(value2)) : new BasicHeader(name, value2);
934      }
935      return isResolving ? new BasicHeader(name, resolver(value)) : new BasicHeader(name, value);
936   }
937
938   private Supplier<Object> resolver(Object input) {
939      return ()->varResolver.resolve(stringify(unwrap(input)));
940   }
941
942   private Object unwrap(Object o) {
943      while (o instanceof Supplier)
944         o = ((Supplier<?>)o).get();
945      return o;
946   }
947
948   private boolean eq(String s1, String s2) {
949      return caseSensitive ? StringUtils.eq(s1, s2) : StringUtils.eqic(s1, s2);
950   }
951
952   @Override /* Object */
953   public String toString() {
954      return "[" + join(this, ", ") + "]";
955   }
956
957   // <FluentSetters>
958
959   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.collections.ControlledArrayList */
960   public HeaderList setUnmodifiable() {
961      super.setUnmodifiable();
962      return this;
963   }
964
965   // </FluentSetters>
